intro: Appendicula torta, commonly known as the twisted appendicula, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Appendicula torta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
